posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We‚Äôre releasing the Signal 7.70 beta soon. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

‚òÖ Still some more fixes for the new calling UI!

Complete list of new commits since 7.69.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.69.2‚Ä¶main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.69 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.70.0 (163700)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

29 new commits since 7.69.2:

Show commits

  • Update username link logo. [1]

    Resolves signalapp/Signal-Android#14258

  • Update to AGP 8.13.2 [2]

  • Move StickerManagementScreen to its own file. [3]

  • Move sticker preview classes to preview subpackage. [4]

  • Make logging more accurate. [5]

  • Do not run reconciliation while there are still uploads in progress. [6]

  • Fix log typo. [7]

  • Include more debug information for debuglog upload failures. [8]

  • Fix case where wallpapers may not be uploaded. [9]

  • Fix bad attachment table test. [10]

  • Potential fix for flakey name collision test. [11]

  • Remove some bad thumbnails from archive reconciliation. [12]

  • Add vertical scrolling to Change Number screen for accessibility. [13]

    The Change Number intro screen was not scrollable, making the Continue
    button inaccessible when users have larger font or display sizes
    configured on their device. Added verticalScroll modifier to the Column
    to allow scrolling when content overflows.

  • Fix conversation list not updating when disappearing message expires [14]

    When a disappearing message expired while the user was on the chat list,
    the message preview would persist until the user navigated into that
    conversation or restarted the app.
    The issue was that deleteMessage() only called notifyConversationListeners(threadId)
    which notifies observers watching a specific thread, but not
    notifyConversationListListeners() which notifies the conversation list UI.
    Other similar operations (like bulk deletes at line 3639) correctly call both.

  • Fetch abandoned attachment files in a transaction. [15]

    Not likely to affect anything because of the existin protected file
    system, more just a defense-and-depth style thing.

  • Add education sheet for key transparency. [16]

  • Add the call quality diagnostics fragment. [17]

  • Improve internal logging for reconciliation errors. [18]

  • Clean up old calling code. [19]

  • Remove call length checks from CallQuality trigger. [20]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.86.11 [21]

  • Fix missing UUID crash in storage service. [22]

  • Update Groups.proto to match shared spec. [23]

  • Rotate backups beta megaphone flag. [24]

  • Poke upload progress when viewing settings. [25]

  • Properly tag account wallpapers as such during export. [26]

  • Improve reconciliation logging and handling. [27]

  • Update translations and other static files. [28]

  • Bump version to 7.70.0 [29]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.69.2‚Ä¶v7.70.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn‚Äôt).

posts.name: ClauZ
posts.cooked:
7.70.0

Call related crash

  1. make group call from device1 starts ringing on all group devices
  2. answer from device2
  3. continues to ring on other devices
  4. leave the call with device1, and device 2
  5. other devices continue to ring
  6. answer the call on device3
  7. leave the call, and the app crashes

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.70.0/6343a53b05d3f24af4b9e1a7cf3957738a7e8cd0f699daed86c8acf174a46026

UI bug

When I try to start a group call there‚Äôs another screen displayed for a split second, something about ‚Äúdeleted account‚Äù

Recording

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.70.0/f8785c9db356cabc9d8472230eac49af8918db4bfa87a90e21e35575c7bdc565

Question

Is there a cool off period for group ringing ? because I‚Äôve noticed that if I end a group call, and then try to start another, it won‚Äôt ring anymore

Calling without play services

So I‚Äôm trying to make a direct call, audio or video doesn‚Äôt matter, from an android without play services, running in waydroid and on the receiving device, which is a physical one I get a missed call directly, without ringing.

Group calls work from the play-servicesless device

posts.cooked: Just a note for everyone that follows these threads that tomorrow (Monday 19 Jan) is a U.S. holiday, so there might not be any development activity.

Avitus:

(Monday 19 Jan) is a U.S. holiday

Oh it‚Äôs Martin Luther King Jr. Day: Martin Luther King Jr. Day | USA | Federal Holidays (third Monday of January every year)

Edit 1: next federal holiday in USA will be on Monday 16 February 2026: Washington's Birthday | USA | Federal Holidays

Edit 2: for the previous edit, it‚Äôs the third Monday of February every year

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
i‚Äôve noticed for several versions now (and now finally got a confirmation) that messages that are a reply seem to take longer to get sent than messages that aren‚Äôt, often resulting in a garbled ordering on the other side and on other clients (especially if you‚Äôre a fast typer like me).

tempFileForShare_20260120-123118719√ó955 118 KB

Screenshot_20260120_1231352213√ó684 28.4 KB

i know that the ordering of messages isn‚Äôt guaranteed and there‚Äôs already several FRs about that, but i am curious if it‚Äôs in any way expected behaviour. are replies that much heavier than regular messages?

timestamps for the two messages by me in the screenshots: 1768908455054 (non reply, the two word one), 1768908449422 (reply, the single word one).
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.70.0/ae2a77513b3ddb81a80cc090ad48e648739bc50ba7898dc76026305aa573ac2c
